title: WWE’s King Corbin says The Rock clash is ‘dream come true’
text:
Corbin was double-teamed by The Rock and Becky Lynch in the Friday Night SmackDown (Picture: WWE)

WWE’s King Corbin got what was coming to him on Friday Night SmackDown last week when he was double-teamed by Dwayne ‘The Rock’ Johnson and ‘The Man’ Becky Lynch to kick off the historic show.

However, for the man behind the arrogant and antagonistic character, getting to work with the legendary superstar was an absolute honour and something he’d wanted to do for a long time.

Speaking in Los Angeles just hours before the show at the Staples Center, Corbin – who only found out about the show opening skit when he arrived at the arena – exclusively told Metro.co.uk: ‘That’s a dream come true. I’ve been here seven years, I don’t think I’ve ever met him. I may have walked by him running around doing something at ‘Mania.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘He’s coming to be a part of the show, he’s probably the biggest icon on the face of the earth right now. For him to find time to part of this shows how big it really is!’

While the big-time Hollywood actor would deliver some scathing put-downs on-screen before hitting Corbin with his signature moves – the People’s Elbow and Rock Bottom – he has gone on to heap praise on the WWE’s current premiere bad guy on social media, telling him he has a ‘lot of talent and potential’ while thanking him for the work they did together in the ring.

Fans are used to seeing the star – who went by Baron Corbin before adopting his royal moniker after winning this year’s King of the Ring tournament – as the ultimate bad guy, the kind of man who reveled in the moment a small child was so angry he beat Kurt Angle in the Hall of Famer’s last ever match at WrestleMania 35 earlier this year that they ‘gave him the finger’.

Corbin, Becky and Rock in the ring (Picture: WWE)

King Corbin is grateful to Triple H (Picture: WWE)

But there’s another side to the former Raw constable and acting general manager, and all round thorn in the side of the WWE’s heroes – and it’s a lighthearted one that viewers watching at home or at the arenas and stadiums around the world rarely see.

The ex-NFL sportsman told us how he once pranked fellow villain Lacey Evans by sneaking some Gummy Bears into her hand during a live show, meaning she had to keep her fist closed for the rest of the match.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘She was eating them backstage, these Gummy Bears. So I handed her them and she couldn’t do anything,’ he laughed.

At this year’s Hall of Fame ceremony, fans got a glimpse of his playful side when he got caught in the crossfire as his boss Paul ‘Triple H’ Levesque chased him down with a water gun in the crown.

‘It was cool because I remember, I was just watching it and for some reason, I caught Hunter’s eye, he looked at me and it’s like, this is going to go badly for me,’ he joked.

‘And he just started chasing me – it’s cool, it’s another thing that’s a testament for their love for this. I wouldn’t be anywhere without Triple H.’

It’s the same kind of relationship he shares with WWE’s owner Vince McMahon, and Corbin admitted it’s very important to know when it’s appropriate to joke around and when he needs to get down to work.

He added: ‘I have a fantastic relationship with Vince. There’s been a couple of times where he’s tried to knock me out of chairs or knock me over and run off – I know when I can do that and when it’s all business. ‘I’m going to try to make you a million dollars tonight,’ and then maybe later he hits me in the back of the head with something and thinks it’s hilarious!’

Advertisement

While Corbin still has his goals of holding championship gold in the WWE and one day making it into the Hall of Fame, he has his plans for when his in-ring career comes to an end – although he doesn’t want to think too far ahead.

‘I’m a guy who lives in the moment,’ he said.

‘I know little things I want to do when I leave WWE, like I want to own a whisky, wine, cigar bar called The Liars Club and it’ll be an awesome bar with crazy oddities in it. I collect oddities, I’ve got human skulls at home.

‘Those are little things, but to the extent staying involved – I just don’t know. You have guys like The Undertaker and Hunter who grab onto me a little bit. They’ve done amazing things – I wanna be in the Hall of Fame. I wanna be the guy where when I’m done, 15 years from now people go “Holy crap, he was really good, we didn’t realise it.” That’s what I want.’

Friday Night SmackDown airs every week at 1am on Sky Sports Arena and Main Event. WWE will be touring the UK next month with a huge double TV taping featuring both Raw and SmackDown superstars in Manchester on 8 November.
description: The wrestler was double-teamed in the ring by Becky Lynch and Dwayne Johnson.
